result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of probation in 15CM1454. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 88 days time served. Court objects to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 88 days time served.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of probation in 15CM1454.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court via telephone, defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense attorney in trial and defendant not produced. Case adjourned to branch 24 for Plea and Sentencing.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter here for motion hearing.  This case is not a domestic abuse case and per the intake schedule, is reassigned to Judge Protasiewica, Branch 24.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. Defense does not wish to argue bail. State's motion to join 15CM2027, 15CM1454, 15CM2123 for trial taken under advisement. Matter set over to branch 40 to address joinder motion. Court VACATED Jury Trial date on case 15CM1454. Case adjourned to branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised due to lower pending case of which these charges stem, this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40
Motion to dismiss COUNT 1  by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am., in Branch 23 for Branch 40
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
